page.title: 12St.Alfege Church
page.content: St.Alfege Church was rebuilt in 1712 and finished in 1714.James Wolfe was buried there in 1759 and there is still a coffin plate to mark his burial place.The church has some stained glass windows.St.Alfege was stoned to death by the Vikings.The doors are made from very thick hardwood and they have very heavy handles. Alfege used to be the Archbishop of Canterbury in the year 1012.The church is a parish church and the Thomas Tallis Choir sings there.There is an organ with large pipes and a church choir too.The building is a dominant part of Greenwich with its white stone,large dome,coppered roof and clock tower.
